intro: Pterygodium excisum, commonly known as the African moonvic, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves, and small white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. The genus Pterygodium is known for its diverse species, many of which are used in traditional medicine.
